business.headline: Sensex, Nifty end higher as trade optimism boosts market sentimentThe S&P BSE Sensex climbed 566.96 points to close at 84,778.84, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 170.90 points to settle at 25,966.05. Broader markets also participated in the rally, even as volatility edged up ahead of the monthly F&O expiry.

How credit cards fuelled India's Diwali shopping partyA new survey has revealed how Indians turned to credit cards for high-value festive buys this Diwali, planning purchases smartly around cashback offers, no-cost EMIs and online deals.

Gold, silver prices are falling. Should you buy now or wait?Gold and silver prices are slipping as global optimism rises and profit-taking kicks in. Experts explain what's driving the fall and whether buyers should wait before investing.

Hospital bills are rising. Here's how to make your health insurance smarterAs medical inflation pushes treatment and hospital costs higher, insurers are reworking pricing and policies. Here's how flexible plans, wellness incentives, and smart choices can help you keep your cover affordable.

Supreme Court allows Centre to reconsider Vodafone Idea's plea on extra AGR duesFor Vodafone Idea, which is already burdened with mounting liabilities and ongoing financial strain, the top court's nod gives the Centre scope to reassess the dues, potentially opening a narrow path for relief or renegotiation.

Why modern parents are building 'Gold Vaults' instead of buying jewelleryParents are rethinking how they gift gold, moving beyond jewellery to create long-term "Gold Vaults" for their children. Here's how this modern plan turns tradition into a smart, inflation-proof investment.

Sensex jumps 600 points: Why is the stock market rising today?At 10:33 am, the NSE Nifty50 surged 171.25 points to 25,966.40, while the BSE Sensex jumped 575.03 points to 84,786.91. Broader market indices also traded higher, mirroring the upbeat sentiment on Dalal Street.

Gold, silver prices continue to fall: What's making precious metals lose their shine?Gold and silver prices are slipping after a strong two-month rally. Here's why the dollar's strength, easing tensions, and Fed expectations are cooling off investor appetite for bullion.

Sensex, Nifty rise as US trade deal hopes lift market moodAt 9:30 am, the BSE Sensex surged 306.28 points to 84,518.16, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 97.55 points to 25,892.70. Most broader market indices also traded higher in early deals, even as market volatility showed a mild uptick.

Luxury vs affordable housing: What homebuyers prefer during festive seasonThe festive months are traditionally seen as an auspicious time to buy homes. But as real estate sentiment rises across cities, one question stands out — are buyers chasing luxury spaces or choosing affordability amid rising costs?

LIC refutes Washington Post report on $3.9-billion Adani investment planA Washington Post report claimed that the Finance Ministry expedited a proposal directing nearly $3.9 billion (Rs 33,000 crore) in investments from the Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) into the Adani Group. The life insurance major rejected the claims as baseless.
Writing a will? These common mistakes can land it in courtFrom Bollywood families to neighbourhood households, inheritance battles have shown that even the most watertight wills can spring leaks.

Reliance says it will comply with new US, Western sanctions on Russian oilThe oil-to-retail behemoth said that it is assessing the implications of restrictions announced by the European Union, the United Kingdom and the United States on crude oil imports from Russia and the export of refined products to Europe.

No trade deals with a gun to our head: Piyush Goyal on India-US trade talksThis special report covers Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal's firm message on India's approach to international trade negotiations, particularly regarding the United States. Speaking at the Berlin Global Dialogue, Mr. Goyal made it clear that India will not be rushed into agreements. He stated, 'we do not do deals in a hurry, and we do not go ahead and sign any deals with deadlines or with a gun to our head'. The minister emphasized that for India, trade deals are not merely about tariffs or market access but are long-term partnerships built on trust and mutual respect between nations. This stance comes amid ongoing trade discussions with both the US and the European Union, where India is advocating for fair and equitable agreements that benefit its businesses and economy in the long run.

Don't do deals with gun to our head: Piyush Goyal on trade talks with USIndia is exploring newer markets to reduce the impact of high tariffs and ensure fair trade terms for its exporters, said Piyush Goyal. He noted that India's approach is guided by strategy and self-interest rather than external pressure.
Sensex closes 320 points lower, Nifty below 25,800; HUL down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 344.52 points to close at 84,211.88, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 96.25 points to end at 25,795.15.

Have you been investing in mutual funds the wrong way all this time?Experts say that most investors rely only on absolute returns while judging a mutual fund's performance. They focus on the number showing how much profit they've made, without understanding the factors behind those returns.

US maize import talks rattle Indian farmers as prices fall below MSPReports suggest that if the trade deal goes through and American maize starts entering Indian markets — prices could crash, and farmers may face huge losses.

Sensex tumbles 600 points: Why the stock market is falling todayThe fall came as investors engaged in profit booking following recent gains. After sustained upward movements, it is common for markets to experience short-term corrections as participants secure returns.

Gold ETFs vs physical gold: What smart investors are looking at, explains expertGold may be timeless, but the way Indians invest in it is changing fast. With rising awareness of hidden costs, gold ETFs are gaining traction as a smarter, hassle-free alternative.

entertainment.headline: Vadh 2 release date out: Neena Gupta, Sanjay Mishra return in spiritual sequel 'Vadh 2', a spiritual sequel to 'Vadh' (2022) explores intense emotions and moral dilemmas. The film, featuring Neena Gupta and Sanjay Mishra, is scheduled for a theatrical release on February 6, 2026.

Mr. Shahid Kapoor please handle your wife: Mira Rajput trolled for cracker ban plea Bollywood actor Shahid Kapoor's wife, Mira Rajput Kapoor, has been trolled by an X user, for her appeal to all on social media to avoid crackers because they cause pollution

Sonal Chauhan confirms role in Mirzapur The Film, calls it an iconic project Actor Sonal Chauhan joined the cast of 'Mirzapur: The Film'. She made the announcement on social media, while expressing gratitude towards Farhan Akhtar and Ritesh Sidhwani.

Squid Game The Challenge 2: When and where to watch the survival reality series Squid Game Season 2 will return with 456 new contestants facing brutal challenges. The series promises shocking twists and a life-changing prize of $4.56 million.

Livvy Dunne shares viral handwritten message from Taylor Swift Pop star Taylor Swift surprised gymnast Livvy Dunne by sending her a gift box containing the new album 'Life of a Showgirl' and a personal handwritten message, drawing significant attention on social media.

Shabana Azmi pays tribute to late actor Satish Shah, recalls their college days Shabana Azmi paid a heartfelt tribute to her late college mate Satish Shah, recalling his jovial nature and their long friendship. The veteran actor died in Mumbai at 74 following complications from a kidney ailment.

Chiranjeevi files complaint over AI-generated deepfake porn videos, urges removal Tollywood actor Chiranjeevi has approached Hyderabad cybercrime police after AI-generated pornographic deepfake videos using his likeness appeared online, prompting calls for immediate takedown and investigation.

Jay Bhanushali and Mahhi Vij call it quits after 14 years of marriage Actors Jay Bhanushali and Mahhi Vij have filed for divorce after 14 years of marriage. The couple, who have a daughter, are reported to have been living separately for some time and facing issues over the past few years.

Lyricist Snehan's father dies at 102, Actor-politician Kamal Haasan pays tribute Tamil lyricist Snehan has shared news of his father Sivasangu Kodumburai's death at age 102. The funeral is set for Pudukariyapatti, Thanjavur district, with tributes led by actor Kamal Haasan.

What Shashi Tharoor wrote about Aryan Khan's The Ba***ds of Bollywood: Read here Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has publicly praised Aryan Khan's debut series 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood', calling it a bold and entertaining satire. The Netflix show, produced by Shah Rukh Khan's Red Chillies, has attracted attention for its sharp writing, insider humour, and star-studded cast.

Rahul Vaidya on Baseer Ali's eviction from Bigg Boss 19: Could've been in top 2 Rahul Vaidya expressed disappointment over Baseer Ali's surprise eviction from 'Bigg Boss 19', calling him a "deserving" contestant who could have reached the top two. Diandra Soares also extended support, wishing him success beyond the show.

Rakhi Sawant calls Farah Khan her sugar mummy; SRK, Salman Khan her godfathers Rakhi Sawant opened up about her close bond with Farah Khan, Shah Rukh Khan, and Salman Khan. She stated that Farah is helping her rebuild her house after rain damage, highlighting their strong relationship.

Kantara Chapter 1: Rishab Shetty's Mayakara transformation wows in new BTS video Rishab Shetty's remarkable transformation into Mayakara in 'Kantara: Chapter 1' has captivated audiences across India, with a behind-the-scenes (BTS) look revealing the artistry and dedication involved in bringing the mystical character to life.

Anupam Kher pays tribute to Yash Chopra after seeing train named in his honour Anupam Kher got emotional during his Switzerland vacation after spotting a train named after legendary filmmaker Yash Chopra at the Jungfrau Railway station. The actor fondly remembered working with Chopra, calling it "the richest time" of his life and praised his unmatched legacy.

Anya Forger: The chaos queen who carries Spy X Family on her tiny back In this week's Animania, we discuss Anya Forger from 'Spy X Family', the pink-haired telepath who turned a spy thriller into a comedy masterpiece. Here's how this chaotic child became anime's most beloved icon.

Parineeti Chopra hilariously reacts to becoming mother, Andaz Apna Apna style Parineeti Chopra shared a funny 'Andaz Apna Apna' clip to express her disbelief about becoming a full-time mom after welcoming her baby boy with Raghav Chadha on October 19.

Satish Shah underwent kidney transplant to care for wife battling Alzheimer's Veteran actor Satish Shah, known for classics like 'Sarabhai vs Sarabhai', and 'Jaane Bhi Do Yaaro', died at 74. Despite his own health struggles, Shah remained devoted to caring for his wife, Madhu, who battles Alzheimer's.

Hrithik to Jackie Chan in witty post: My broken bones look up to your broken bones Bollywood superstar Hrithik Roshan's latest Instagram post, where he poses with martial arts legend Jackie Chan, has gone viral.

Actor R Madhavan is Edison of India GD Naidu in first look teaser of biopic GDN Actor R Madhavan's first look teaser as inventor GD Naidu is revealed in a new biopic teaser. The film highlights Naidu's contributions as a pioneering Indian inventor.

general news.headline: Forensics student uses LPG agent ex-lover's help to kill partner, set home ablazeThe victim was killed allegedly by his live-in partner and two others, who later set his flat ablaze to pass the murder off as an accident. What was initially thought to be an air-conditioner blast was, in fact, a carefully orchestrated cover-up.

Yunus gifts map to Pak general showing India's Northeast in Bangladesh, stirs rowBangladesh interim chief Muhammad Yunus was seen presenting a Pakistani general with a controversial map depicting Assam and other northeastern states as part of Bangladesh.

Teen dies by suicide after being blackmailed with obscene AI pics of sistersFaridabad suicide: The accused allegedly threatened to release AI-generated morphed pictures and videos of the Faridabad youth and his sisters if he failed to pay Rs 20,000. Unable to cope with the humiliation, Rahul took his life.

Shreyas Iyer in ICU in Sydney after internal bleeding from rib injury: ReportAustralia vs India: Shreyas Iyer has been admitted to ICU in Sydney after suffering internal bleeding from a rib injury during an ODI in Sydney on Saturday. The ODi vice-captain is expected to remain in the Sydney hospital for at least a week.
Pakistan's Kutch diversion?Sixty years ago, Pakistan's first military dictator launched a military thrust in Kutch. Could history repeat itself?

Cyclone Montha live: Trains, schools cancelled as Andhra, Tamil Nadu, Odisha brace for stormCyclone Montha over the Bay of Bengal is set to intensify into a severe cyclonic storm by October 28 morning, likely making landfall near Kakinada. Andhra Pradesh has been put on alert while Odisha, Telangana, and Chennai are also bracing for strong winds and rainfall as the system moves north-northwestward.

It was a general meme: Kangana Ranaut regrets 2020 farmers' protest tweetKangana Ranaut in 2020 had posted on X, misidentifying Mahinder Kaur as Bilkis Dadi, one of the faces of the anti-CAA protests at Shaheen Bagh, and alleged that the woman was "available for Rs 100" to attend demonstrations.

The reel nation, manufactured reality and the Street of CrocodilesIn a nation consumed by reels, our sense of reality is blurring. What once was life has become content, and the line between real and reel is vanishing fast.

Do not try this: Indians deported in shackles by US warn of big risksDozens of Indians from Haryana, Goa, and Gujarat were deported from the US in handcuffs and shackles after attempting to enter the country illegally via the donkey route. Many paid lakhs to agents and spent months in detention after being caught. This brings the total number of Indians deported from the US this year to over 1,600.

Pak-inspired Islamists plan siege of Dhaka for non-Muslim tag on AhmadiyyasIslamist groups in Bangladesh are mobilising for a massive rally in Dhaka on November 15. They are demanding that the Muhammad Yunus government declare the Ahmadiyya Muslim community "non-Muslim", following Pakistan's model of communal persecution. With clerics threatening that fire of revolt would engulf Bangladesh if their demand wasn't met, fear has gripped the tiny Ahmadiyya community.

India shown in bad light: Top court raps states for not filing reports on stray dogsHearing a suo motu case titled 'In Re: City Hounded By Strays, Kids Pay The Price', a bench of Justice Vikram Nath, Justice Sandeep Mehta and Justice NV Anjaria expressed strong displeasure over the non-compliance, observing that incidents of stray dog attacks were "showing the country in a bad light before foreign nations".

Two crashes in 30 minutes: US loses fighter jet, navy chopper in South China SeaTwo US Navy aircraft crashed within 30 minutes of one another in the South China Sea during separate operations. China has said the crashes occurred during a military exercise. The US Navy has launched a probe into the causes of the crashes in the geopolitically sensitive region, with some alleging foul play.

Mr. Shahid Kapoor please handle your wife: Mira Rajput trolled for cracker ban pleaBollywood actor Shahid Kapoor's wife, Mira Rajput Kapoor, has been trolled by an X user, for her appeal to all on social media to avoid crackers because they cause pollution

YouTuber under fire for India cow dung festival video. His 'not racist' defenceThe video, which has garnered five million views on X, drew criticism from social media users who accused 25-year-old YouTuber Tyler Oliveira of mocking a tradition and ignoring its religious significance.

Twist in Delhi acid attack case: Accused's wife alleges rape by survivor's fatherThe case of an acid attack on a Delhi University student has taken a new twist with the accused's wife filing a rape complaint against the victim's father.

Ankle injury ends Pratika Rawal's World Cup journey before Australia semifinal: ReportIndia's World Cup campaign has reportedly hit a hurdle, with opener Pratika Rawal likely to miss the semi-final against Australia. The in-form batter twisted her ankle during the final league match against Bangladesh.

ORS is in the spotlight: Why is it a lifesaving medicine?ORS has been an important medical breakthrough in saving children from diarrhoeal dehydration in India. Recent FSSAI regulations target fake ORS products, but gaps in legal challenges and awareness persist.

Jay Bhanushali and Mahhi Vij call it quits after 14 years of marriageActors Jay Bhanushali and Mahhi Vij have filed for divorce after 14 years of marriage. The couple, who have a daughter, are reported to have been living separately for some time and facing issues over the past few years.

SpiceJet flight to Dubai makes emergency landing in Chennai after technical snagFlight SG23 from Madurai to Dubai was carrying 160 passengers and seven crew members on board. The airline was yet to comment on the incident.

Indian woman raped in 'racially aggravated' attack in UK, suspect caught on CCTVThe police confirmed that the woman was assaulted because of her racial identity. They released a picture of the suspect and appealed to locals for active cooperation.

British man asks why National Museum of India has few artefacts, gets savage responseIn a video, a British vlogger was seen walking through the galleries of the National Museum of India with a fellow traveller.

Techies by day, cabbies at night: Why Bengaluru engineers are driving Ola, UberEver had cab drivers in Bengaluru answer your call in fluent corporate lingo? Chances are, they might have been techies. It's not just for the money. Software engineers are driving cabs to beat loneliness at home and drudgery at the office, revealing a problem in our corporate culture.

Justice Surya Kant in line to be next Chief Justice, 1st Haryanvi to hold postOnce the recommendation gets the go-ahead from the Law Ministry, Justice Surya Kant will become the 53rd CJI and is expected to serve till February 9, 2027.

Gold, silver prices continue to fall: What's making precious metals lose their shine?Gold and silver prices are slipping after a strong two-month rally. Here's why the dollar's strength, easing tensions, and Fed expectations are cooling off investor appetite for bullion.

sports.headline: Mitchell Marsh has a route back for Australia's Ashes squad: Andrew McDonald Australia coach Andrew McDonald has stated that the door is firmly open on Mitchell Marsh's return to the Test squad for the upcoming Ashes series. Marsh last played a Test match in 2024.

Australia players provided police escort in Mumbai after Indore incident Australian women cricketers were given police escorts in Navi Mumbai following harassment in Indore. The incident has led to tightened security measures to protect players during the World Cup.

How Xabi Alonso's gutsy tactics helped Real Madrid cut through Barcelona's fading edge Xabi Alonso's first El Clasico as Real Madrid manager was a tactical statement wrapped in nostalgia. Calm on the touchline and bold in his calls, he outwitted Barcelona to deliver Madrid's sweetest revenge yet.

PAK vs SA: Pakistan coach reveals Babar Azam's batting position on T20I return Babar Azam is set to return to Pakistan's T20I team, batting at number three against South Africa. This move aims to strengthen Pakistan's top order ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026.

Ankle injury ends Pratika Rawal's World Cup journey before Australia semifinal: Report India's World Cup campaign has reportedly hit a hurdle, with opener Pratika Rawal likely to miss the semi-final against Australia. The in-form batter twisted her ankle during the final league match against Bangladesh.
IND vs SA: Temba Bavuma is back, South Africa name 15-man squad for India Tests South Africa have named their squad for the upcoming Test series against India with Temba Bavuma returning as captain.

PV Sindhu ends 2025 season early after failing to recover from foot injury Two-time Olympic medallist PV Sindhu, 30, confirmed on Monday that she was ending her season early. Sindhu, who reached the quarterfinal of the World Championships in August, has been recovering from a foot injury.

Hungry for runs, Prithvi Shaw hits 2nd fastest double-hundred in Ranji Trophy Prithvi Shaw scored a blistering double century in only his second match for Maharashtra. This innings marks one of the fastest double hundreds in Ranji Trophy history, raising expectations around his domestic form.

I deserved better: Out of favour stars hit out at chief selector Ajit Agarkar India batters Karun Nair and Ajinkya Rahane hit out at chief selector Ajit Agarkar after hitting respective hundreds in the Ranji Trophy.

Shreyas Iyer medically stable, recovering well in Sydney after rib injury: BCCI Shreyas Iyer remains in Sydney's ICU after sustaining a laceration to the spleen during the third ODI against Australia. Medical teams are closely monitoring his recovery, with his return to cricket uncertain.

Shreyas Iyer In ICU! Star Cricketer Suffers Internal Bleeding After Horror On-Field Injury This special report focuses on Indian ODI Vice-Captain Shreyas Iyer, who has been admitted to the ICU in a Sydney hospital. The cricketer is suffering from internal bleeding caused by a ribcage injury sustained while taking a catch in the third ODI against Australia. Sources within the BCCI are indicating that 'this is an internal bleeding that he's suffering from.' The report details the moments leading to the injury, the swift action by the medical team, and the potential impact on his career and India's upcoming fixtures, including the ODI series against South Africa which he is now set to miss. Iyer is expected to remain under close medical observation for at least a week before he can travel back to India.

Don't scare Rohit and Virat with age talk: Ex-selector sends stern message to BCCIFormer selector Kris Srikkanth insists Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli should not be judged by age as they prepare for the 2027 World Cup. Rohit and Kohli stitched a match-winning 168-run stand in the third ODI against Australia in Sydney on Saturday.

Lamine Yamal, Vinicius Jr. involved in heated altercation after El ClasicoBarcelona star Lamine Yamal was confronted by Real Madrid players at the end of the El Clasico on Sunday. Madrid's Vinicius Jr. was seen having a go at the Barca youngster.

The ODi vice-captain is expected to remain in the Sydney hospital for at least a week.

Navi Mumbai's love affair with women's cricket results in new attendance recordsWomen's World Cup 2025: Navi Mumbai witnessed attendance records being broken twice in as many matches. Having turned up in large numbers to support the India women's team, the city will fittingly host India's semifinal against Australia on Thursday, followed by the grand final on Sunday.

Rohit reflects on unprecedented 5-month break, rediscovering game his own wayAustralia vs India: Speaking to the BCCI after his match-winning hundred in Sydney, Rohit Sharma credited the work he put in during his five-month break for his strong comeback. Rohit shed 11 kilograms while working on his fitness and refining his skills in Mumbai ahead of the Australia tour.

Ajinkya Rahane fires shots at Agarkar, says India missed him in AustraliaBatter Ajinkya Rahane hit out at the Indian Cricket Board after a marathon 159-run knock against Chhattisgarh on Sunday. Rahane called out the selectors for snubbing him from tour of Australia.

Jujitsu player Rohini Kalam dies by suicide, sister links death to work stressInternational jujitsu player Rohini Kalam, who represented India at the 2022 Asian Games, was found dead at her home in Dewas. Police suspect suicide and have launched an investigation into the circumstances of her death.

Radha Yadav alive and kicking, puts her hand up for Australia semi-finalWomen's World Cup: Radha Yadav delivered a stunning performance against Bangladesh, taking three wickets for 30 runs. She also effected a brilliant run-out of Nigar Sultana Joty, showcasing why she is widely regarded as one of India's fittest cricketers and a top-class fielder.

Pat Cummins to miss first Ashes Test, but Australia upbeat on his recoveryAshes 2025-26: Australia on Monday confirmed that their captain Pat Cummins will miss the first Test, starting November 21, against England in Perth. Steve Smith will lead the side in the fast bowler's absence.

Security intensified in Navi Mumbai after Australian players' harassment in IndoreThe security has been intensified in Navi Mumbai for the remaining games of the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 in the aftermath of the molestation incident involving Australian cricketers in Indore.

Jannik Sinner wins Vienna Open title after fighting back to beat Alexander ZverevVienna Open: Jannik Sinner beat Germany's Alexander Zverev 3-6, 6-3, 7-5 in the final on Sunday, securing his fourth ATP Tour title of the season. Sinner has now won 21 consecutive matches on indoor hardcourts.

Why the Chess World Cup 2025 could shape the future of Indian chessThe Chess World Cup 2025 is a crucial tournament for India's players. With the home advantage, they must make the most of this opportunity to ensure the continued strength and depth of Indian chess in the coming years.

Premier League: Arsenal extend lead at the top, Manchester City suffer lossArsenal secured a narrow victory over Crystal Palace, thanks to Eberechi Eze's first league goal for the club on Sunday, October 26. Manchester City's winning run came to an end against Aston Villa as Matty Cash's goal proved to be decisive.

El Clasico: Real Madrid down Barcelona 2-1 to extend lead at top of LaLigaKylian Mbappe and Jude Bellingham were on target as Real Madrid beat Barcelona 2-1 to strengthen their spot at the top of the LaLiga points table. Barca were left to rue their chances and lost Pedri to a red card in the final moments of the game.

Pratika Rawal freak injury: Harmanpreet Kaur shares an update on India openerWomen's World Cup, IND vs BAN: Indian captain Harmanpreet Kaur shared an update on Pratika Rawal, who sustained an injury during the clash against Bangladesh at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

Chess World Cup 2025: Decoding the format of the tournamentThe Chess World Cup 2025 will be played from October 31, 2025 to November 27, 2025 and this represents a golden chance for the Indian Chess grandmasters to seal their spot in the Candidates 2026 tournament.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
